text:
This used to work:

LogFormat "%h %l %u %t \"%V %r\" %>s %b mod_gzip: %{mod_gzip_result}n In:%
{mod_gzip_input_size}n Out:%{mod_gzip_output_size}n:%
{mod_gzip_compression_ratio}npct. \"%{Referer}i\" \"%{User-agent}i\" \"%{cookie}
n\" %{Client-ip}i" common_with_mod_gzip_info2

CustomLog /var/log/httpd/mod_gzip.log common_with_mod_gzip_info2

Starting with Apache 1.3.31, on the logfile I only register the 
literal "common_with_mod_gzip_info2" (without quotes) for each hit.
creator: xavi@caballe.com
xavi@caballe.com
text:
Just to clarify, before upgrading to 1.3.31 (I was running 1.3.29) the logfile 
was something like this:

fj1000.inktomisearch.com - - [12/May/2004:23:53:04 +0200] "www.caballe.com 
GET / HTTP/1.0" 200 19452 mod_gzip: OK In:88732 Out:19247:79pct. "-
" "Mozilla/5.0 (compatible; Yahoo! Slurp; 
http://help.yahoo.com/help/us/ysearch/slurp)" "-" -

After installing 1.3.31, the only thing registered for a each hit was

common_with_mod_gzip_info2

In order to log all the information I had to change the CustomLog configuration 
as follows:

CustomLog /var/log/httpd/mod_gzip.log "%h %l %u %t \"%V %r\" %>s %b mod_gzip: %
{mod_gzip_result}n In:%{mod_gzip_input_size}n Out:%{mod_gzip_output_size}n:%
{mod_gzip_compression_ratio}npct. \"%{Referer}i\" \"%{User-agent}i\" \"%{cookie}
n\" %{Client-ip}i"
